member.name: T:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator
member.summary: Validator for AWS EventBridge Scheduler schedule expressions (CRON and rate). Supports format validation and minimum timespan checks between executions.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.ValidateFormat(System.String)
member.summary:
Validates if the schedule expression is a valid AWS EventBridge format (CRON, rate, or at). Should be one of the following formats:
cron({cron expression})
{cron expression}
rate({rate expression})
at({at expression})
member.param: The schedule expression to validate.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.ValidateWithIntervals(System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Validates schedule expression format and ensures timespan constraints between executions. For CRON, checks intervals between occurrences against min/max. For rate, checks rate interval against min/max. For at, validates only if no min/max constraints (one-time has no intervals).
member.param: The schedule expression.
Minimum allowed timespan between executions (optional).
Maximum allowed timespan between executions (optional).
member.returns: True if valid format and respects constraints, false otherwise.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.GetNextOccurrences(System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Gets the next expected execution times for a schedule expression.
member.param: The schedule expression.
Maximum number of occurrences to return.
Optional start time to calculate from.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.ValidateCronFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a CRON expression.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.ValidateRateFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a rate expression.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.ValidateAtFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Validates an at expression.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.TryCreateQuartzExpression(System.String,Quartz.CronExpression@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse a string representation of a cron schedule and create a corresponding Quartz CronExpression object.
member.param: The string containing the cron expression to be parsed. Must be in a valid cron format, either prefixed with 'cron(' or as a standard cron expression.
When the method returns, contains the created CronExpression object if parsing succeeds; otherwise, contains null.
member.returns: true if the cron expression was successfully parsed and a CronExpression object was created; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.GetRateInterval(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the interval for a rate expression.

member.name: T:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator`1
member.summary: FluentValidation validator for AWS EventBridge schedule expressions.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator`1.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: FluentValidation validator for AWS EventBridge schedule expressions.

member.name: P:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator`1.Name
member.summary: AwsScheduleExpressionValidator

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator`1.IsValid(FluentValidation.ValidationContext{`0},System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified cron expression against the defined minimum and maximum interval constraints.
member.remarks: This method uses the AwsScheduleExpressionValidator to ensure that the cron expression adheres to the configured interval limits.
member.param: The validation context that provides additional information about the validation operation.
The cron expression to validate. Must be formatted according to AWS standards.
member.returns: true if the cron expression is valid according to the specified interval constraints; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidator`1.GetDefaultMessageTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a default error message template that describes the error condition based on defined interval constraints.
member.remarks: The returned message template varies depending on whether minimum or maximum interval constraints are defined. If both are present, the message includes both constraints; if only one is defined, the message reflects that specific constraint; if neither is defined, a generic error message is returned.
member.param: The error code that identifies the specific error condition being reported.
member.returns: A string containing the default message template for the error condition, reflecting the presence of minimum and/or maximum interval constraints.

member.name: T:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for FluentValidation.

member.name: T:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationExtensions.<G>$E2C5CDFC69AA32776B65B66836CA9D74`1.<M>$DFC9A0AC3EBCBA561726E8279759E563
member.summary: Adds AWS schedule expression validation to a FluentValidation rule builder.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationExtensions.<G>$E2C5CDFC69AA32776B65B66836CA9D74`1.MustBeValidAwsSchedule
member.summary: Adds a validator to ensure that the provided AWS schedule expression conforms to AWS scheduling standards.
member.remarks: This method uses the to validate the format and correctness of AWS schedule expressions. Use this method when you need to enforce AWS schedule expression validity within a FluentValidation rule set.
member.returns: An instance of that enables further rule configuration.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationExtensions.<G>$E2C5CDFC69AA32776B65B66836CA9D74`1.MustBeValidAwsSchedule(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds a validator to ensure that the provided schedule expression conforms to AWS scheduling rules and meets the specified minimum interval between executions.
member.remarks: Use this method to enforce AWS scheduling constraints when validating schedule expressions. The validator checks both the syntactic validity and the minimum interval requirement, helping prevent misconfiguration of scheduled tasks.
member.param: The minimum allowed time interval between scheduled executions. Must be a positive TimeSpan value.
member.returns: An IRuleBuilderOptions instance that enables further configuration of validation rules for the schedule expression.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationExtensions.<G>$E2C5CDFC69AA32776B65B66836CA9D74`1.MustBeValidAwsSchedule(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Adds a validator that ensures the provided schedule expression conforms to AWS scheduling requirements, optionally enforcing minimum and maximum interval constraints between scheduled events.
member.remarks: Use this method to validate AWS schedule expressions within a FluentValidation rule, ensuring they meet specified interval requirements. The validator checks that the schedule expression is valid according to AWS rules and that the intervals between scheduled events comply with the provided constraints.
member.param: The minimum allowed interval between scheduled events. Specify to indicate no minimum constraint. Must be a positive if provided.
The maximum allowed interval between scheduled events. Specify to indicate no maximum constraint. Must be a positive if provided.
member.returns: An instance that enables further configuration of validation rules.

member.name: T:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult
member.summary: Represents the result of validating an AWS schedule expression, indicating whether the expression is valid and providing error details if validation fails.
member.remarks: Use the static property to represent a successful validation result with no errors.
member.param: Indicates whether the AWS schedule expression is valid. A value of signifies a valid expression; otherwise, .
Specifies the type of validation error encountered, if any. This value identifies the nature of the validation failure.
Provides a descriptive message related to the validation result. The message may include guidance or details about the validation outcome.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult.#ctor(System.Boolean,AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleValidationError,System.String)
member.summary: Represents the result of validating an AWS schedule expression, indicating whether the expression is valid and providing error details if validation fails.
member.remarks: Use the static property to represent a successful validation result with no errors.
member.param: Indicates whether the AWS schedule expression is valid. A value of signifies a valid expression; otherwise, .
Specifies the type of validation error encountered, if any. This value identifies the nature of the validation failure.
Provides a descriptive message related to the validation result. The message may include guidance or details about the validation outcome.

member.name: P:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates whether the AWS schedule expression is valid. A value of signifies a valid expression; otherwise, .

member.name: P:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult.Error
member.summary: Specifies the type of validation error encountered, if any. This value identifies the nature of the validation failure.

member.name: P:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult.Message
member.summary: Provides a descriptive message related to the validation result. The message may include guidance or details about the validation outcome.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.WithMinInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the minimum interval that must be observed between scheduled events for validation purposes.
member.param: The minimum interval, as a , that scheduled expressions must adhere to. Must be a positive duration.
member.returns: The current instance, enabling method chaining.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.WithMaxInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the maximum interval allowed for schedule expression validation.
member.remarks: Use this method to enforce an upper limit on the interval when validating schedule expressions. This helps ensure that only intervals within the specified range are considered valid.
member.param: The maximum time span permitted for the interval. Must be a positive value.
member.returns: The current instance of the AwsScheduleExpressionValidation for method chaining.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.ThrowExceptionOnFailure
member.summary: Enables exception throwing when validation fails, allowing callers to handle errors through exception handling.
member.returns: The current instance of the AwsScheduleExpressionValidation class, enabling method chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when the schedule expression format is invalid.
Thrown when the interval configuration is invalid (e.g., negative intervals, min greater than max).
Thrown when the schedule expression violates specified interval constraints.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.WithOccurrenceCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the occurrence count used for schedule expression validation and returns the current instance for method chaining.
member.param: The number of occurrences to use for validation. Must be a non-negative integer.
member.returns: The current instance of with the updated occurrence count.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.WithOccurrenceStart(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Sets the start date and time for the occurrence schedule.
member.remarks: This method allows for configuring the start time of the occurrence, which is essential for scheduling tasks accurately.
member.param: The date and time when the occurrence should start. This value cannot be in the past.
member.returns: Returns the current instance of the AwsScheduleExpressionValidation for method chaining.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.IsValid
member.summary: Validates the AWS schedule expression and its associated interval constraints.
member.remarks: This method checks the format of the schedule expression and ensures that any specified minimum and maximum intervals are valid and logically consistent. To return a more declarative response, use the method instead.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidation.Evaluate
member.summary: Validates the AWS schedule expression and its associated interval constraints.
member.remarks: This method checks the format of the schedule expression and ensures that any specified minimum and maximum intervals are valid and logically consistent. It returns a success result if all validations pass, or a failure result with detailed error information if any validation fails. To return a simple boolean result, use the method instead.
member.returns: An instance of AwsScheduleExpressionValidationResult indicating whether the schedule expression and interval configuration are valid. Returns a failure result with an appropriate error if validation does not succeed.

member.name: M:AwsScheduleExpressionValidator.AwsScheduleExpressionValidationExtensions.ValidateAwsScheduleExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified AWS schedule expression and returns the result of the validation.
member.remarks: This method is an extension method for the string class, enabling a fluent interface for validating AWS schedule expressions.
member.param: The AWS schedule expression to validate. This string must conform to the AWS schedule expression format.
member.returns: An instance of AwsScheduleExpressionValidation that indicates whether the expression is valid and provides details about any validation errors.
